item.title: 1 error compile
item.dc:creator: @AndyJay123 AndyJay123
item.description:
@AndyJay123 wrote:

public void quest()
{
/* QUEST 1 */
if(questid == 1)
{
if(q1stage == 0)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", "To start this quest talk with "+GetNpcName(549), "who can be found in Varrock Armour", "shop, good luck.", "", "", "", "", "", "");
}
if(q1stage == 1)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", GetNpcName(549)+" has asked me to collect the resources", "needed to make the armour", "These include:", GetItemName(451), GetItemName(2339), GetItemName(1777), "", "", "");
}
if(q1stage == 2)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", "I now need to collect the "+GetItemName(6889), "so that "+GetNpcName(549)+" can make the armour.", "", "", "", "", "", "", "");
}
if(q1stage == 3)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", "All "+GetNpcName(549)+" needs now is", "a "+GetItemName(4206)+" to add the power to the armour.", "The crystal can be found in the caves", "of Relleka, North of Camelot.", "But be careful, as there is many dangerous", "creatures there...", "", "", "");
}
if(q1stage == 4)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", "You have the "+GetItemName(4206)+".", "Return to Horvik for your reward!", "", "", "", "", "", "", "");
}
if(q1stage == -1)
{
loadquest("Invisible Armour", "@gre@QUEST COMPLETE!", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "");
}
}

As long as it has the same brackets ect as that above - It should work…

And you also need to finish of this part…

if(q1stage == 0)
{
loadquest("New Armour");YOU NEED A FUNCTION HERE 
}

Read full topic

Go for it =p

/* QUEST 1 */ if(questid == 1) { if(q1stage == 0) { loadquest("New Armour"); } if(q1stage == 1) { loadquest("New Armour", GetNpcName(39)+" has asked me to collect the following", GetItemName(4725), GetItemName(3339), GetItemName(4087), GetItemName(4757), GetItemName(2370), GetItemName(582), "Black knights fortress", "South Draynor n South Varrock"); } if(q1stage == -1) { loadquest("New Armour", "@gre@QUEST COMPLETED!", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", ""); } }

item.title: 1 error compile
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Forget the brackets and parentheses! You have them all!

The loadquest() method obviously needs more arguments. Can you even read? It is like you can’t operate a vending machine without putting money in and hitting a pop buttons, two arguments. operateVendingMachine(int Money, Pop popChoice) cannot be applied to operateVendingMachine(myMoney). :mad: You need to have all the arguments filled in. :rolleyes:
